question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What team did Rodney Smith play for in 2010?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
"The Court of Dreams: Rodney Smith's Baylor Legacy"

In the heart of Waco, Texas, where the Brazos River flows and the Baylor University campus comes alive, a young Rodney Smith stepped onto the court, ready to etch his name in the annals of college basketball history. From 1996 to 1999, Smith donned the green and gold of the Baylor Bears men's basketball team, leaving an indelible mark on the program. As a freshman, Smith burst onto the scene, his athleticism and agility earning him a spot in the starting lineup. Coach Harry Miller, a seasoned veteran of the college basketball circuit, saw something special in the young player from Texas. Miller's trust in Smith was rewarded as the freshman averaged 10.5 points per game, helping the Bears secure a 15-13 overall record and a 7-7 mark in the Southwest Conference. The 1996-1997 season was just the beginning of Smith's impressive collegiate career. As a sophomore, he continued to flourish, increasing his scoring average to 12.8 points per game. His breakout performance came on February 15, 1997, when he dropped 25 points on the Texas Tech Red Raiders, leading the Bears to a thrilling 83-79 overtime victory. This win marked a turning point in the season, as Baylor went on to win five of their last seven games, finishing with a respectable 18-12 record. Smith's junior year was perhaps his most impressive. He became a dominant force in the paint, averaging 14.2 points and 6.5 rebounds per game. On January 17, 1998, he recorded a career-high 30 points against the Oklahoma Sooners, guiding the Bears to a 91-84 upset victory. This win propelled Baylor to a 10-2 record in the Big 12 Conference, earning them a berth in the National Invitation Tournament (NIT). As a senior, Smith continued to lead by example, serving as a captain and mentor to his younger teammates. Although the Bears struggled to find consistency, Smith remained a bright spot, averaging 12.1 points and 5.8 rebounds per game. His final collegiate game was a testament to his unwavering dedication, as he scored 20 points in a hard-fought 75-68 loss to the Kansas State Wildcats in the first round of the NIT.
content.source_2:
Title: The Unlikely Journey of Rodney Smith

Prologue: The College Years (1996-1999)

Rodney Smith's basketball career was on fire at Baylor University. For three years, he dominated the court, leading his team to victory after victory. The roar of the crowd, the thrill of the game, and the rush of adrenaline were all he knew. But as graduation loomed, Rodney began to wonder what lay beyond the confines of the college arena. Chapter 1: The Lost Years (1999-2024)

After college, Rodney's basketball career stalled. He bounced from team to team, never quite finding his footing. The years blurred together in a haze of disappointment and frustration. He worked odd jobs to make ends meet, his passion for the game slowly dwindling. It seemed as though his athletic prime had come and gone, leaving him with nothing but memories of his glory days. Chapter 2: A New Chapter (February 18, 2024)

On a chilly winter morning, Rodney received an unexpected call from the Real Monarchs, the reserve team of Real Salt Lake. They were looking for a new player, and Rodney's name had been tossed around as a long shot. Desperate for a fresh start, he jumped at the opportunity. As he signed the contract, a spark reignited within him. This was his chance to prove himself, to show the world that he still had what it took to succeed. Chapter 3: The Rise of Rodney Smith (2024-2030)

Rodney threw himself into his new role, pouring every ounce of energy into training and perfecting his skills. The Real Monarchs took notice, and soon he became an integral part of the team. Games turned into wins, and wins turned into championships. The crowd roared once more, and Rodney's name was on everyone's lips. He had found his second wind, and it felt exhilarating. Chapter 4: The Golden Years (2030-2035)

As the years passed, Rodney's legend grew. He became a leader on and off the field, guiding his teammates with wisdom and experience. The Real Monarchs flourished under his guidance, and Rodney's name was etched into the annals of soccer history. He had come full circle, from college basketball star to soccer sensation. The world marveled at his transformation, and Rodney basked in the adoration.
